intro: Tetradema urdanetense, commonly known as the Urdanet bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
